intro: Acroelytrum, commonly known as the golden cupplant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has a distinctive rosette of basal leaves and a tall, hollow stem that supports its showy inflorescence. Acroelytrum thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its ornamental value is complemented by its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
